extendedInfo.description: Med Helper keeps track of prescriptions, alarms remind you when medications need to be taken, notify you when Doctors appointments are scheduled and alert you when meds are running low or are about to expire. Med Helper also tracks your vital signs and PRN / take-as-needed medications. You can log and export reports to your Doctor, Nurse or Caregiver and multiple profiles let you manage others in your care. Whether youâre self managing or taking care of your loved ones Med Helper is easy to use and there to help. Itâs like having your very own Mobile Healthcare Assistant.Depending on your needs, Med Helperâs features can help you manage very simple to very complex situations. Med Helper Features include: Prescription list- Name- Medication Alias- RX Number- Instructions- Reason- Description- Side EffectsSchedule- Start date- End date- Schedule pattern- Reminder Times / Alarm set- Snooze - Taken atInventory - Refills Remaining- Current inventory- Expiration DateContact - Doctor- PharmacyDaily Schedule- Time of Day- Dosage - Calendar viewTake as needed (PRN)- Amount taken- Time taken- Last 10 doses / 24/hrMed Log- Daily view- Calendar view- Able to manageVitals Tracked- Part of day- Exercise- Temperature- Weight- Pulse- Glucose- HbA1c- Pain levels- Blood Pressure- OxygenExportable ReportsPeople use Med Helper as a:  Medication reminder - Prescription tracker - Pill reminder - Vitals tracker - Doctor or Pharmacist appointment manager - RX reminder - Med reminder - Medication monitor and reports tracker - Medicine reminder - Medicine scheduler - virtual Pillbox - Individual or family medication reminder - Symptom tracker - Doctors list and Pharmacy organizer as well as a way to share information with their caregivers.How ever you choose to use Med Helper we hope it helps make your life a little bit easier. Med Helper is being designed by people just like you. Over the past two years we've received thousands of emails with suggestion comments and reviews. People let us know what they like - what they want and sometimes what they don't like. We listen and design accordingly. Our belief is that Better Healthcare Needs Better Tools... and better tools are best designed by those who use them. Meaning YOU. For any information, suggestions or help of any kind please contact us at:  info@medhelperapp.com We're at your service....Note: No network connection is required for Med Helper to operate.All the best - From the Med Helper Team

reviews.title: Best app of it\'s kind!
reviews.comment: I sincerely wish this app had been out when I worked in home health.   I can think of only two improvement and it may already be there and I haven\'t come across it.    In vitals it needs a place for Respiratory Rate and if med are taken at a different time it world be nice if it automatically altered the schedule to reflect the change.
reviews.author: Vidurr Skjoldrbrot

reviews.title: Best app on my phone.
reviews.comment: I have bipolar and rely on my meds to keep me sane. For the first time in my life I\'m able to take my meds on time every day. Thank you developers.
reviews.author: Sarah Rosenzweig

reviews.title: Great, but needs better alarm
reviews.comment: Love that you can set individual alarm times throughout the day.  The alarm makes a tiny noise just once, then shows notification at to of phone.  Needs real alarm that can be heard and ring repeatedly until turned off.
reviews.author: Bee K

reviews.title: Had to delete it
reviews.comment: Reminders would not work.  I was always immediately losing my info - and could not save inputs (Dr.or pharmacy). I uninstalled it for that reason.   Maybe the paid version is better, but if it is as bad as the free one, save your money.
reviews.author: Timothy Conover

reviews.title: Love it!
reviews.comment: Helps me keep track of my many medications. The best medication tracker on the market! I recommend this app to everyone who asks me how I manage all of my different medications.
reviews.author: Katrina Donner

reviews.title: Love it!
reviews.comment: As a forgetful chronically I\'ll individual with a hubby and kiddo with ADD I love this app! Especially the inventory tool. No more running out of meds and forgetting to get them refilled.
reviews.author: Jennifer Bradshaw

reviews.title: Love it again
reviews.comment: This one of the few Medical Information apps that I\'ve found that requires very few permissions to run and allows you to access the information in an elevator. I also love the multiple profiles. I even added my cat. My problem is that the app needs a way to input pics for each profile. Fix this then 5 stars.
reviews.author: Linette Taylor

reviews.title: great app
reviews.comment: im newly diagnosed as a diabetec, with high blood preasure. love this app. i can keep track of all my meds. with reminders. as well as track my blood sugar levels and email them to my doctor.... GREAT APP.
reviews.author: Robert Lewis

reviews.title: Excellent App
reviews.comment: This is a fantastic app. I love how you can create profiles for different members of the family--great for moms. I also like the Med Log, where I can see what pill was taken when. Very convenient.
reviews.author: Michele Rackham

reviews.title: It no longer works on my droid
reviews.comment: Last update screwed it up keep tapping take now but nothing happens...only option is exit.......sucks...used to work fine.
reviews.author: Jerry Cohen

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: This app does what I want. It does what it says. It tracks my medication. It tells me how many pills I have left. You can set it to remind you  when your pills get low in quantity. You can set that number yourself. For a free version of this app, it\'s absolutely awesome. I can\'t think of anything else I need in a pill reminder.
reviews.author: Peter Hickie

reviews.title: Great App.  Extremely Helpful
reviews.comment: I have tried many pill reminder apps, but this one has everything I have been looking for.  I recently had a shoulder surgery and with this app I am able to track my use of pain medication and pain levels.  The only improvement I can think of would be to provide charts of medication usage and vitals.
reviews.author: Steve Ollinger

reviews.title: Essential app
reviews.comment: I recently have had to start taking medication and am very forgetful so this app is essential to me. It is very simple but it is all you really need. It is very straightforward and easy to use
reviews.author: James C

reviews.title: This version vs Pro
reviews.comment: What is different in the paid version?  I wish this app had the capability to sync to multiple devices.  Back up doesn\'t work to install on new device.  I figured it out.  Thank you.  Works fine.
reviews.author: Rick Freiberg

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: What a fantastic app. Just had my dental surgery and this helped me a lot to keep up with my medicine intake. Setting interval of a minute and when its time, alarm beeps every min,  I hate those frightening nonstop loud scream, I mean alarm but this app is perfect.
reviews.author: Jackey Niraula

reviews.title: Love This App!
reviews.comment: My wife takes a lot of medication for multiple symptoms. Her doctors are always wanting us to keep records of vitals, and medication schedules. This app does it all! Very easy to set up, it keeps track of all medications, you can set up multiple profiles, so you can track more than one person\'s medications, etc. I showed the app to my nurse and she thought it was great too, made a note of it and was going to download it for herself!  Two items I would like the developers to address: 1) Have an option to make the alarms louder, and more than just one simple beep. 2) In the Inventory Tracking, there seems to be a bug. If you need to adjust the quantities, when you go into edit mode, sometimes the counts are WAY OFF (ie. edit inventory shows inventory quantity as \"56\" but display quantity shows \"4\". If you try to enter what you actually have, say, 6, when you save, it shows quantity of \"-50\". The only way to correct this is to delete the medication and start over.
reviews.author: Roger Cureton

reviews.title: A lot to ask
reviews.comment: I have a complex medical situation so I dl the top 5 Med assist apps. I highly suggest people do the same since they offer different tools, styles etc.they were all good, this fit my needs best. Ability to note doctors, appointments, meds, times etc excellent. What I would like to see is patches added to medication types, shared app for caretaker patients, repeated appointment option (ie enter info and repeat every month (no issue paying for more options) I just saw email will send this to u
reviews.author: Jae Elle

reviews.title: Amazing app
reviews.comment: Love this app. Parts of the app I love: 1. Schedule: keeps a detailed log of when I took my medication so I can see if I skipped a dose on a particular day. 2. Prescriptions: Allows you to enter a great amount of detail about a prescription, invaluable for reference and for scheduling. 3. Take as Needed: Very useful for tracking medication not taken regularly. 4. Manage Profile: Very useful for families. Tracks multiple people. 5. Reporting: Useful for sending medication history to Dr. or others. 6. Doctors / Pharmacies: Usually entered in the Prescription field but nice to see an overview.  Part 2, not so useful features (at least for me): 1. Med Log: duplicates the Schedule function because Schedule already shows past events. 2. Vitals: I keep this with my medical records because it is not taken too often. This app doesn\'t seem to USE this information in any practical way. If tracking this all the time recommend device such as Fitbit. 3. Notes: Already places to put notes in most other categories, but I could see some people using this. 4. Appointments: I use a calendar for this and this app does not allow calendar syncing. Don\'t find this function useful even if it did sync.
reviews.author: Aaron Klapheck

reviews.title: Great app. I use it daily.
reviews.comment: Wish the look had not changed. This new style: blocks, sguares, looks like a kids toy. Not very high tech or modern or even artistic. Still a good app.
reviews.author: Charlene Steele

reviews.title: Best I\'ve seen, lacking key ingredient
reviews.comment: Great app. The only thing I would like added is a way to import medicines. A data reference that already has all info on most meds. I don\'t know what meds interact and this could help flag some things before I swallow. It would also be nice to not have multiple active entries when both my doctor and dentist prescribe me ibuprofen. This could be avoided with a centralized med database, and then just referencing who prescribed them.
reviews.author: Matthew Eskuchen
